    • Method Detail

      • solveEq

        public static double solveEq(java.lang.String equation)
                      throws ExpressionFormatException
        This function solves an infix arithmetic expression. Each arithmetical term needs to be separated by comma. 
 The expression needs to be enclosed with opening and closing brackets.
 Operations that are allowed are : 
 | : Square root. (âˆš)
 ^ : Power.
 * and / : multiplication and division.
 + and - : addition and subtraction. 
 Incase of using negative numbers, for example (-3), enter it as "(,0,-,3,)".  
 
         For example, "((10.2,+,3)*5)" is valid expression.
        Parameters:
        equation - Infix arithmetic expression that needs to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        Value of the arithmetic expression, if the arithmetic expression is valid.
        Throws:
        ExpressionFormatException - Throws exception if the entered infix expression is invalid.
